intro: Cissus cussonioides, commonly known as the creeping fig or silver vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by round, red berries. It is well adapted to humid environments and thrives in partial shade. Its rapid growth and trailing habit make it popular for ornamental use in gardens and as a houseplant.
